section.title: Roles and users
section.para: The infrastructure offers some predefined roles and users.

section.title: Predefined Roles Overview
section.para:
The following predefined roles exist:
System Administrator
System Inspector (Read only super user)
A System Inspector is allowed to retrieve any resource object, but he/she is not allowed to create or update objects.
Administrator
Depositor
MD-Editor
Moderator
Ingester
User Group Administrator
User Group Inspector
Statistics-Editor
Statistics-Reader
Detailed information about these roles can be found in the section "Predefined Roles" (of the API documentations of the AA component).

section.title: Default Privileges Overview
section.para: Besides the defined roles, some default privileges exist for every user, even for the anonymous user, that tries access to the services without providing an eSciDoc user handle. The default privileges are described in the section "Default Privileges" (of the API documentations of the AA component).

section.title: Predefined users
section.para: If using the installer, 3 users are predefined for testing purposes. 1 systemadministrator, 1 systeminspector (read-only administrator) and 1 depositor. While installing you are asked to choose a loginId and password for each of these users. For the systeminspector a persistent handle (=choosen password) is created. This handle never expires, so you always can use the handle without logging in. The handle is needed for the indexing-process that is done by fedoragsearch.
